page.title: 04 Life in Chartham Hatch (2)
page.content: Most people worked outside the village in Canterbury, Faversham, Ashford and surrounding towns.Only 10 of the 300 families were farmworkers' families. The village school has been closed since 1960 and converted into a village hall. The two ladies previously mentioned were on the village hall committee. The ladies went apple picking in the summer along with many of the other village wives. The Canterbury City Council was allowing rural industries to develop but were carefully controlling this development.The Manpower Services Commission had carried out recent improvements to the village hall.The two ladies considered that there was a strong sense of community in the village with everyone helping everyone else.
